title: Add ca-ES for localization
body: Add catalan language for localization.

title: Pointer events for the drag behavior.
Combined d3.behavior.drag touch improvements (Win8 pointers, multiple touchmove)
body: This adds Win8 support on top of the recent multiple finger improvements. Supersedes both #1792 and #1795.

title: Get d3.behavior.drag working in Win8
body:
This makes `d3.behavior.drag` track unified Pointer Events when available, instead of mouse and touch. Enables dragging on touchscreen Win8 devices.

Note this also includes a fix for "different finger" move/end events on all platforms, I can split out if desired but this was especially needed for the Pointer Events for correct multiple finger support.

title: Better multitouch.
body:
This fixes a bug where all touches would ending on any touch ending.

The drag behavior registers a touchend listener for each started touch; however, a touchend event is dispatched to ALL listeners when any touch ends, not just for the corresponding starting touch. The drag behavior must therefore detect whenever the ending touch is the corresponding starting touch, and ignore other ending touches.

This fixes the drag behavior during multitouch, as discussed in #1786.

title: Add pt-BR for localization.
body: Taken into account multiple locales support, and not custom build.

title: Prefer interpolateNumber when coercible to number.
body: Objects that are coercible to numbers, such as Dates, are often more usefully interpolated as numbers rather than as objects. Related #1779.

title: Add date interpolation and tests
body:
This enhances the built-in interpolation routine to correctly handle Date objects.

This is how it can be used:

``` javascript
> date1 = new Date(2010, 1, 0)
Sun Jan 31 2010 00:00:00 GMT-0800 (PST)
> date2 = new Date(2014, 1, 0)
Fri Jan 31 2014 00:00:00 GMT-0800 (PST)
> d3.interpolate(date1, date2)(0.3)
Thu Apr 14 2011 08:12:00 GMT-0700 (PDT)
```

title: d3.bisector takes a comparator rather than an accessor.
body:
Fixes #1766. Unlike d3.bisector(accessor), this allows you to define a bisector that works in reverse order.

An awkward aspect of implementing bisection on top of a comparator is that it is often the case that the sorted array contains objects (e.g., rows from a TSV), while the search value is a primitive value (e.g., a number). Thus, you want to apply an accessor to the array elements but not to the search value.

The solution here is to invoke the comparator deterministically: the first argument is always an element from the array, and the second argument is always the search value. This lets a comparator apply an accessor to array elements but not to search values.

title: Define "d3", not an anonymous module.
body:
almond.js will choke on anonymous modules, hence

```
define(function() {})
```

should look like this instead:

```
define("someName", function() {})
```

More information here: https://github.com/jrburke/almond#common-errors

title: Support custom interpolation functions.
body:
If the target value of d3.interpolate exposes an `interpolate` property, use that as the interpolator rather than the default. Also define custom interpolators for colors.

This commit has two notable ramifications. First, it changes the behavior of interpolation when the target value is an instance of d3.hcl, d3.hsl or d3.lab: rather than using the RGB colorspace for interpolation, the colorspace of the target color is used. (Note that for HSL colors expressed as strings like "hsl(…)", RGB interpolation is still used.) Second, if the target value has an "interpolate" property that is truthy but not a function, a TypeError is thrown.
Work-in-progress branch for the next patch release.

title: Better ticks for subsecond domains.
body: Rather than starting the ticks on the minimum domain value, round up based on the step size. Fixes #1757.

title: pass in extra arguments to time.format.multi predicate functions
Workaround for lack of symmetry in Math.sin (Chrome 33 bug).
body:
Due to a recent regression in Chrome 33, we can’t necessarily rely on Math.sin(x) being symmetric about zero, so we need some minor workarounds where it matters.

This fixes area calculations for degenerate zero-area polygons such as the one mentioned in #1753, and any potential impact this could have for the point-in-polygon algorithm (used for clipping).

title: control of d3.svg.arc sweep direction
body:
Allows control of the sweep direction on paths generated with d3.svg.arc.  This is particularly useful when the path will be used for an `<svg:textPath>`, since the sweep direction controls which side of the path the text will attach to (see http://bl.ocks.org/telic/9160262).

For compatibility with existing uses of d3.svg.arc, I've made the negativeSweep accessor fallback to a `false` value when a data object is not supplied and the accessor has not been overridden.

title: Return empty string instead of null for empty paths.
body:
This will keep the `d` attribute from getting removed from `path`
elements when the data is empty.

Closes #1737

title: Extended projection.scale to accept arrays
body:
Extended projection.scale to accept arrays ([x,y]).

Backwards compatible with older version of projection.scale.

title: add domain() when layout.stack
body:
when use d3.layout.stack, usually we re-calculate domain corresponding to "value",
so in this commit, I add domain method to d3.layout.stack.

title: Locale currency suffix overwritten by SI-prefix
body: Corrects a bug where the currency suffix was overwritten by SI-prefix formatting.

title: add text wrapping routine
body: Adds a .textWrap() function which can be configured with .bounds() and .padding() and applied to a text selection using .call(), and will then auto-calculate text length and positioning for dividing into tspans accordingly.

title: 100% to 125% faster #rgb/#rrggbb string parsing across all platforms.
body: Tests pass. http://jsperf.com/rgb-str-vs-regex

title: Fix outdated copyright year (update to 2014)
body:
The copyright year was out of date. Copyright notices must reflect the current year. This commit updates the listed year to 2014.

see: http://www.copyright.gov/circs/circ01.pdf for more info

title: Fix for singleton ordinal domains
body:
If an ordinal scale has a singleton domain and the range uses rangePoints or rangeBands, then all non-members of the domain will be mapped to the singleton member.  They should be mapped to undefined instead.

[Also:  The logic for returning the range given a domain value relied on javascript modulo returning NaN if the range is empty, and has the side effect that a "-1" property is added to the range for rangePoints/rangeBands ordinals where a non-domain member is mapped.  Seems unlikely that anything actually relies on that behavior but I didn't try to clean it up just to be safe.  Because of that, though, the code is still a little opaque, at least to me.]

title: d3.weightedMean
body: Saw #1605 request, which I have used many times in the past. Also added some tests (blatantly using mean-test.js as a template).

title: Include more metadata in bower.json; fixes #1707.
update bower: keywords, author, repository, and description.
body: update bower configuration with keywords, the author, repository location, and repo description.
